topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1: Add a Disk to Starter Object Ring

body.p: Perform the following procedure to add disk to a starter object ring.

li.xref: Add disks to a Starter Object Ring

section.title: Prerequisite

ul.li: HP Helion OpenStack cloud is successfully deployed.(Starter Swift nodes are functional by default as they are part of cloud deployment.)
All of the rings generated must be preserved, preferably at more than one location. Swift needs these rings to be consistent across all nodes.
Make a backup of the rings before any operation.

section.p: Note: If the scale out swift nodes are not deployed, you need to perform the following:

li.p: Create a directory named ring-building.
Get all the rings and builder files from either of the starter nodes.

codeblock.codeph: rsync -qzp --rsync-path="sudo rsync" heat-admin@<starter Swift nodes IP address>:/etc/swift/object.ring.gz /root/ring-building/ rsync -qzp --rsync-path="sudo rsync" heat-admin@<starter Swift nodes IP address>:/etc/swift/account.ring.gz /root/ring-building/ rsync -qzp --rsync-path="sudo rsync" heat-admin@<starter Swift nodes IP address>:/etc/swift/container.ring.gz /root/ring-building/ rsync -qzp --rsync-path="sudo rsync" heat-admin@<starter Swift nodes IP address>:/etc/swift/object.builder /root/ring-building/ rsync -qzp --rsync-path="sudo rsync" heat-admin@<starter Swift nodes IP address>:/etc/swift/account.builder /root/ring-building/ rsync -qzp --rsync-path="sudo rsync" heat-admin@<starter Swift nodes IP address>:

section.title: Prepare the undercloud to manage Swift Clusters

li.p: Enable SSH from the undercloud to the overcloud node by copying the SSH keys from the seed to the undercloud.
Log in to the seed.
Copy the SSH key from the seed cloud to undercloud.
Log in to the undercloud.

codeblock.codeph: # ssh heat-admin@<undercloud IP address> # sudo -i # mv ~heat-admin/id_rsa ~/.ssh/

section.title: Add disks to a Starter Object Ring
section.p: Perform the following steps to add Swift disk to a ring:

li.p: Log in to the undercloud from seed.
Change the directory to ring builder.
List the starter Swift nodes.
The following sample displays starter Swift nodes:
List the disks on the starter nodes.

codeblock.codeph: # ringos list-disks -n <starter Swift nodes IP address>

li.p: The following sample displays the lists of disk available on the starter Swift node 192.0.2.22.
Format the given disk.

codeblock.codeph: # ringos format-disks -n <starter Swift nodes IP address> -d <disk>

li.p: Note: You can format all the disks with the single command (-d --all).
The following sample displays the output of formatted disk of 192.0.2.22.
List the file in ring directory and identify the object.builder file for object.
(Optional)If the builder file does not exit in the undercloud, copy the builder files using the following command.

codeblock.codeph: rsync -qzp --rsync-path="sudo rsync" heat-admin@<starter Swift nodes IP address>:/etc/swift/object.builder /root/ring-building/

li.p: Add the formatted disk to object ring.

codeblock.codeph: # ringos add-disk-to-ring -f /root/ring-building/object.builder -i <Starter Swift nodes IP address> -p <port> -d <disk label> -w <weight> -r <region> -z <zone>

li.p: Note:

ul.li: Choose the zone and region information appropriately.
The disk label is derived from step 5.

li.p: Recommendation:

ul.li: Add drives gradually using a weighted approach to avoid degraded performance of Swift cluster. The weight will gradually increase by 25% until it becomes 100%. The initial weight is 25.

li.p: Re-balance the ring.
Note: You must wait for the time specified by min_part_hours before another re-balance succeeds.
List all the Swift nodes.
Copy the object file to all the nodes.
Copy the builder file to all the nodes.
Note: The .buldier and .ring.gz files must be present in the Swift nodes.
You can also copy the ring files and the builder files to all the swift nodes using the following commands:

codeblock.codeph:
# ringos copy-ring -s /root/ring-building/\*.ring.gz -n all
# ringos copy-ring -s /root/ring-building/object-1.builder -n all

li.p: Set the weight of the disks using the following command:
Repeat steps from 8-13 gradually increasing the disk weight by 25: set the weight to 50, 75, and finally 100 (w= 50, 75, 100) .
